channel.title: CVE Feed for ThimPress -- Thim Elementor Kit
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ThimPress -- Thim Elementor Kit

item.title: CVE-2024-4329|2024-05-11T06:43:40.751Z -- thimpress -- Thim Elementor Kit
item.description: The Thim Elementor Kit plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘id’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.9 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-34415|2024-05-09T11:34:51.622Z -- ThimPress -- Thim Elementor Kit
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in ThimPress Thim Elementor Kit allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Thim Elementor Kit: from n/a through 1.1.8.
